title: Intel Spending Billions to Revive Manufacturing
itunes:title: Intel Spending Billions to Revive Manufacturing
description:
Elizabeth Stuart, Professor of American Health at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health, explains how mental health issues as a result of Covid-19 may last beyond the pandemic. Bloomberg Businessweek Editor Joel Weber and Bloomberg News Europe Autos Team Leader Craig Trudell discuss traditional automakers catching up to Tesla in the electric vehicle space. Bloomberg News U.S. Semiconductor & Networking Reporter Ian King and Bloomberg Intelligence Senior Semiconductor Analyst Anand Srinivasan break down Intel's ambitious bid to regain its manufacturing lead by spending billions of dollars on new factories and creating a foundry business that will make chips for other companies. And we Drive to the Close with Dave Mazza, Managing Director and Head of Product at Direxion.

See omnystudio.com/listener for privacy information.
